parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (11240002) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandated for campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to the National Liberal Party (PNL) and encourages voters to vote for them.  It also identifies Mircea Minea as the mayor, implicitly linking his candidacy to the PNL. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of Facebook as a platform further supports this. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters to support the PNL. The phrases "Trebuie să votăm Partidul Național Liberal" (We must vote for the National Liberal Party) and "Hai să nu lăsăm țara să o ia razna!" (Let's not let the country go crazy!) directly aim to influence voting behavior. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific political party and candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the post expresses an opinion about the PNL's situation, it's presented as a call to action, not a personal reflection. The call to vote directly contradicts the idea of a personal opinion not intended to influence the vote.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2041957979608071</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (implicitly Mircea Minea through his position as mayor and affiliation with PNL), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters to support the PNL. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's content is not journalistic or a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal for votes. The timing of the post (after the official campaign period) is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Mircea Minea</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Partidul Național Liberal (PNL)</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Mircea Minea, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 2041957979608071), cu scopul de a influența votul în favoarea Partidului Național Liberal,  prin afirmații precum „Trebuie să votăm Partidul Național Liberal” și „Hai să nu lăsăm țara să o ia razna!”,  având un efect electoral clar pozitiv asupra candidatului Mircea Minea și PNL. Postarea, care a beneficiat de o investiție financiară între 200 și 299 RON, a atins o audiență estimată la peste 1 milion de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library, și conține un număr CMF (11240002), indicând clar natura sa de material electoral.  Contactul advertiserului este mineachiajna@gmail.com și +40770114557. Această postare constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei electorale, conform legislației în vigoare.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
